verses.verse: Rejoice <WH8055> not, O Israel <WH3478>, for joy <WH1524>, as other people <WH5971>: for thou hast gone a whoring <WH2181> from thy God <WH430>, thou hast loved <WH157> a reward <WH868> upon every cornfloor <WH1637> <WH1715>.
The floor <WH1637> and the winepress <WH3342> shall not feed <WH7462> them, and the new wine <WH8492> shall fail <WH3584> in her.
They shall not dwell <WH3427> in the LORD's <WH3068> land <WH776>; but Ephraim <WH669> shall return <WH7725> to Egypt <WH4714>, and they shall eat <WH398> unclean <WH2931> things in Assyria <WH804>.

They shall not offer <WH5258> wine <WH3196> offerings to the LORD <WH3068>, neither shall they be pleasing <WH6149> unto him: their sacrifices <WH2077> shall be unto them as the bread <WH3899> of mourners <WH205>; all that eat <WH398> thereof shall be polluted <WH2930>: for their bread <WH3899> for their soul <WH5315> shall not come <WH935> into the house <WH1004> of the LORD <WH3068>.
What will ye do <WH6213> in the solemn <WH4150> day <WH3117>, and in the day <WH3117> of the feast <WH2282> of the LORD <WH3068>?

For, lo, they are gone <WH1980> because of destruction <WH7701>: Egypt <WH4714> shall gather them up <WH6908>, Memphis <WH4644> shall bury <WH6912> them: the pleasant <WH4261> places for their silver <WH3701>, nettles <WH7057> shall possess <WH3423> them: thorns <WH2336> shall be in their tabernacles <WH168>.

The days <WH3117> of visitation <WH6486> are come <WH935>, the days <WH3117> of recompence <WH7966> are come <WH935>; Israel <WH3478> shall know <WH3045> it: the prophet <WH5030> is a fool <WH191>, the spiritual <WH7307> man <WH376> is mad <WH7696>, for the multitude <WH7230> of thine iniquity <WH5771>, and the great <WH7227> hatred <WH4895>.

The watchman <WH6822> of Ephraim <WH669> was with my God <WH430>: but the prophet <WH5030> is a snare <WH6341> of a fowler <WH3352> in all his ways <WH1870>, and hatred <WH4895> in the house <WH1004> of his God <WH430>.

They have deeply <WH6009> corrupted <WH7843> themselves, as in the days <WH3117> of Gibeah <WH1390>: therefore he will remember <WH2142> their iniquity <WH5771>, he will visit <WH6485> their sins <WH2403>.

I found <WH4672> Israel <WH3478> like grapes <WH6025> in the wilderness <WH4057>; I saw <WH7200> your fathers <WH1> as the firstripe <WH1063> in the fig tree <WH8384> at her first time <WH7225>: but they went <WH935> to Baal-peor <WH1187>, and separated <WH5144> themselves unto that shame <WH1322>; and their abominations <WH8251> were according as they loved <WH157>.
As for Ephraim <WH669>, their glory <WH3519> shall fly away <WH5774> like a bird <WH5775>, from the birth <WH3205>, and from the womb <WH990>, and from the conception <WH2032>.
Though they bring up <WH1431> their children <WH1121>, yet will I bereave <WH7921> them, that there shall not be a man <WH120> left: yea, woe <WH188> also to them when I depart <WH5493> from them!
Ephraim <WH669>, as I saw <WH7200> Tyrus <WH6865>, is planted <WH8362> in a pleasant place <WH5116>: but Ephraim <WH669> shall bring forth <WH3318> his children <WH1121> to the murderer <WH2026>.
Give <WH5414> them, O LORD <WH3068>: what wilt thou give <WH5414>? give <WH5414> them a miscarrying <WH7921> womb <WH7358> and dry <WH6784> breasts <WH7699>.

All their wickedness <WH7451> is in Gilgal <WH1537>: for there I hated <WH8130> them: for the wickedness <WH7455> of their doings <WH4611> I will drive them out <WH1644> of mine house <WH1004>, I will love <WH160> them no more <WH3254>: all their princes <WH8269> are revolters <WH5637>.

Ephraim <WH669> is smitten <WH5221>, their root <WH8328> is dried up <WH3001>, they shall bear <WH6213> no fruit <WH6529>: yea, though they bring forth <WH3205>, yet will I slay <WH4191> even the beloved <WH4261> fruit of their womb <WH990>.
My God <WH430> will cast them away <WH3988>, because they did not hearken <WH8085> unto him: and they shall be wanderers <WH5074> among the nations <WH1471>.
